thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: U.S. Government Bonds Decline as Risk Sentiment Improves

author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Decline as Risk Sentiment Improves
text:
U.S. government bond prices edged lower Monday as investor risk appetite improved following limited airstrikes in Syria and a report showed that retail sales grew in March.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.834%, the highest closing level since March 26, from 2.828% Friday. Yields rise as bond prices decline. The two-year yield reached its highest closing mark since August 2008, at 2.377%.
Yields...
